author: Anonymous Beaker
title: HtDW with Compound Data: water-balloon-starter
question:
Hi, I looked at the solution for the water-balloon starter and I'm not sure why we are subtracting the angular speed from the angle. Also since angular speed is an optional constant and I choose not to include it what would my next world state be in terms of the angle? 
(@htdf next-bs)
(@signature BalloonState -> BalloonState)
;; advance bs by LINEAR-SPEED and ANGULAR-SPEED
(check-expect (next-bs (make-bs 1 12))
              (make-bs (+ 1 LINEAR-SPEED) (- 12 ANGULAR-SPEED)))
student_answer:
+ angle makes the balloon rotate counterclockwise.
- angle makes the balloon rotate clockwise.
To me, it made more sense that a balloon being thrown to the right would spin clockwise but again that's just me.
